Title:
First successful isolation of Entoloma clypeatum species
complex from basidiospores
Keywords:
Harushimeji, Isolation, ITS sequence, n-butyric acid, Pure
culture
Abstract:
The Entoloma clypeatum species complex, known as
“Harushimeji” in Japan, associates with Rosaceae and Ulmaceae plant
species. In this study, we successfully isolated cultures of this fungal
group via basidiospore isolation. We tested four Harushimeji species
with modified Norkranss C (MNC) medium and MNC medium containing
n-butyric acid. Colony formation was observed on 22 of 25 basidioma
samples; however, most exhibited slow and unsteady growth. The isolated
mycelia contained dikaryotic hyphae and were identified through
molecular phylogenetic analyses of the internal transcribed spacer
region of fungal ribosomal RNA. Six isolates showed steady growth and
were deposited in the fungal culture collection of the Fungus/Mushroom
Resource and Research Center, Faculty of Agriculture, Tottori
University, Japan, as Tottori University Fungal Culture Collection
strains. These results indicate that basidiospore isolation is a useful
method for obtaining Harushimeji strains.
